Class SqlStatementBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.flyway.core.migration.sql.SqlStatementBuilder
Direct Known Subclasses:
DB2SqlStatementBuilder, DerbySqlStatementBuilder, H2SqlStatementBuilder, HsqlSqlStatementBuilder, MySQLSqlStatementBuilder, OracleSqlStatementBuilder, PostgreSQLSqlStatementBuilder, SQLServerSqlStatementBuilder
public class SqlStatementBuilder
extends java.lang.Object

Builds a SQL statement, one line at a time.

Checks whether the statement is still empty.

Returns:

isTerminated

Checks whether the statement being built is now properly terminated.

Returns:

getSqlStatement

public SqlStatement getSqlStatement()
Returns:
The assembled statement, with the delimiter stripped off.

extractNewDelimiterFromLine

public Delimiter extractNewDelimiterFromLine(java.lang.String line)
Analyses this line Ã¡nd extracts the new default delimiter. This method is only called between statements and looks for explicit delimiter change directives.

Returns:
The new delimiter. null if it is the same as the current one.

isCommentDirective

public boolean isCommentDirective(java.lang.String line)
Checks whether this line is in fact a directive disguised as a comment.

Parameters:
line - The line to analyse.
Returns:
true if it is a directive that should be processed by the database, false if not.

isSingleLineComment

public boolean isSingleLineComment(java.lang.String line)
Checks whether this line is just a single-line comment outside a statement or not.

Parameters:
line - The line to analyse.
Returns:
true if it is, false if not.

addLine

public void addLine(java.lang.String line)
Adds this line to the current statement being built.

Parameters:
line - The line to add.

endsWithOpenMultilineStringLiteral

protected boolean endsWithOpenMultilineStringLiteral(java.lang.String line)
Checks whether this line ends the statement with an open multi-line string literal (which will be continued on the next line).

Parameters:
line - The line that was just added to the statement.
Returns:
true if the statement is unfinished and the end is currently in the middle of a multi-line string literal. false if not.

changeDelimiterIfNecessary

protected Delimiter changeDelimiterIfNecessary(java.lang.String line,
                                               Delimiter delimiter)
Checks whether this line in the sql script indicates that the statement delimiter will be different from the current one. Useful for database-specific stored procedures and block constructs.

Parameters:
line - The line to analyse.
delimiter - The current delimiter.
Returns:
The new delimiter to use (can be the same as the current one) or null for no delimiter.
